grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 廃棄【ハイキ】disposal, abandonment, scrapping, discarding, abolition, annulment, cancellation, abrogation, repeal
退廃【タイハイ】degeneration, decadence, deterioration, laxness, corruption
改廃【カイハイ】reform and (or) abolition, alteration or repeal, revision, reorganization, reorganisation
kun reading compounds: 廃れる【すたれる】to go out of use, to become obsolete, to die out, to go out of fashion
廃る【すたる】to go out of use, to become obsolete, to die out, to go out of fashion, to become lost (e.g. of dignity), to be sullied
